intro: Stachytarpheta roraimensis var. pubescens, commonly known as the Roraima shrub, is a herbaceous plant native to the humid regions of South America, particularly in Venezuela and Brazil. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and clusters of small, two-lipped flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical lowland forests and is often found in shaded, moist environments. Its flowers, which range in color from white to purple, attract a variety of pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
